65c5a793-a94e-4d0b-a284-3b808a5d4722.20833e77-a301-4e1c-889c-9ad737868172.description=6c25e88f-f192-4780-b9e7-99f3c2079ea1.45bdf845-e331-4aa2-8224-a81af8841b5c.description 65c5a793-a94e-4d0b-a284-3b808a5d4722.27f2b495-b3ac-4fe0-a03e-23cba9967c0f.description=6c25e88f-f192-4780-b9e7-99f3c2079ea1.8d4ab81f-1c9a-4648-9369-3197bc6209c7.description 65c5a793-a94e-4d0b-a284-3b808a5d4722.39a79a0c-d3d5-49ca-91c6-3a7f73aed114.description= Inputs\: command - executes ValidateDataGuardBrokerSwitchover.py Call Wrapper - Required\: Command that will execute the step. Oracle Home - Oracle Home of the target database Oracle SID - Oracle SID of target machine Oracle sys password - Required\: SYS Password for the primary and secondary databases. Oracle user name - Required\: Owner of the Oracle database software. Primary Node Hostnames - Required\: Comma-separated list of primary database server host names or IP addresses. If more than one IP address/hostname is entered, it indicates that the primary database is on RAC. Standby Node Hostnames - Required\: Comma-separated list of up to 30 standby database server host names or IP addresses. If more than one IP address/hostname is entered, it indicates that the standby database is on RAC. Switchover DB Unique Name - Required\: Unique name of the standby database that will become the primary database in a switchover or failover operation. This parameter is required if the Switchover or Failover task is specified. host - Target to run this command against password - Login information for host username - Login information for host protocol - ssh/wmi timeout - Time (ms) before auto-exit\: use ${ExtendedTimeout} to lengthen. Results\: Oracle Home - Oracle Home of the target database Oracle SID - Oracle SID of target machine Oracle sys password - Required\: SYS Password for the primary and secondary databases. Oracle user name - Required\: Owner of the Oracle database software. Primary DB Unique Name - No description Primary Node Hostnames - Required\: Comma-separated list of primary database server host names or IP addresses. If more than one IP address/hostname is entered, it indicates that the primary database is on RAC. Standby Node Hostnames - Required\: Comma-separated list of up to 30 standby database server host names or IP addresses. If more than one IP address/hostname is entered, it indicates that the standby database is on RAC. Switchover DB Unique Name - Required\: Unique name of the standby database that will become the primary database in a switchover or failover operation. This parameter is required if the Switchover or Failover task is specified. Exit Code - Exit code of the step needed for branching. 65c5a793-a94e-4d0b-a284-3b808a5d4722.4a37a36e-8f65-44e0-a7ad-e6d111f813fb.description= Inputs\: command - executes GatherParametersforDataGuardBrokerSwitchover.py Oracle Account - Required\: The user who owns ORACLE_HOME. Oracle sys password - Required\: SYS Password for the primary and secondary databases. Primary Node Hostnames - Required\: Comma-separated list of primary database server host names or IP addresses. If more than one IP address/hostname is entered, it indicates that the primary database is on RAC. Standby Node Hostnames - Required\: Comma-separated list of up to 30 standby database server host names or IP addresses. If more than one IP address/hostname is entered, it indicates that the standby database is on RAC. Switchover DB Unique Name - Required\: Unique name of the standby database that will become the primary database in a switchover or failover operation. This parameter is required if the Switchover or Failover task is specified. Instance.Name - No description Server.Become Routine - No description host - Target to run this command against password - Login information for host username - Login information for host protocol - ssh/wmi timeout - Time (ms) before auto-exit\: use ${ExtendedTimeout} to lengthen. Results\: Instance Wrapper - Jython call wrapper to run as the Oracle Instance owner. Oracle Account - The user who owns ORACLE_HOME. Oracle Home - Oracle Home of the target database Oracle SID - Oracle SID of target machine Oracle sys password - Required\: SYS Password for the primary and secondary databases. Primary Node Hostnames - Required\: Comma-separated list of primary database server host names or IP addresses. If more than one IP address/hostname is entered, it indicates that the primary database is on RAC. Server Wrapper - Jython call wrapper to run as the admin user. Standby Node Hostnames - Required\: Comma-separated list of up to 30 standby database server host names or IP addresses. If more than one IP address/hostname is entered, it indicates that the standby database is on RAC. Switchover DB Unique Name - Required\: Unique name of the standby database that will become the primary database in a switchover or failover operation. This parameter is required if the Switchover or Failover task is specified. Exit Code - Exit code of the step needed for branching. 65c5a793-a94e-4d0b-a284-3b808a5d4722.99c332ae-62d6-4150-a0d8-05dedb54119a.description=6c25e88f-f192-4780-b9e7-99f3c2079ea1.67e36f6c-368c-4a4f-978a-5bfd9c8440f6.description 65c5a793-a94e-4d0b-a284-3b808a5d4722.description=
 Purpose

This workflow enables you to perform a Data Guard Broker switchover which will flip the roles of standby and primary databases on an existing Oracle 11.2 (or later) Data Guard configuration. 


 Dependencies

This workflow requires Oracle Database Enterprise Edition version 11.2 (or later). It assumes that Oracle Data Guard has been provisioned and Data Guard Configuration has been set up. This can been done by running workflows Provision Oracle Data Guard and Create Data Guard Configuration. 

This workflow also requires root and oracle user ID equivalence across all primary and standby database servers represented in the Data Guard configuration.

 Usage Instructions

Review the input parameters listed below, and create a deployment using values appropriate for your environment. This workflow is intended to run on the primary database server.

 Required Inputs

    Server Target - The desired target to run this flow against.
    Server Target Username - The user to login to the Server Target as.
    Server Target Password - The password to login as the Server Target Username.
    Download Source Host - The target host where the files needed for this flow can be downloaded from.
    Download Source Path - The path to where the files can be found on the Download Source Host.
    Instance.Name - No description
    Oracle Account - Required\: The user who owns ORACLE_HOME.
    Oracle sys password - Required\: SYS Password for the primary and secondary databases.
    Primary Node Hostnames - Required\: Comma-separated list of primary database server host names or IP addresses. If more than one IP address/hostname is entered, it indicates that the primary database is on RAC.
    Server.Become Routine - No description
    Standby Node Hostnames - Required\: Comma-separated list of up to 30 standby database server host names or IP addresses. If more than one IP address/hostname is entered, it indicates that the standby database is on RAC.
    Switchover DB Unique Name - Required\: Unique name of the standby database that will become the primary database in a switchover or failover operation. This parameter is required if the Switchover or Failover task is specified.

 Optional Inputs

    Clean Code Base - Remove code base from target after execution (True || False).
    Clean JRE - Remove JRE from target after execution (True || False).
    Debug Level - Set level of output [(least) 1-5 (most)]

 Results Verification

The Console will indicate whether the workflow completed without errors. The Output tab  will indicate whether the specific Broker operation was successful. 

To further verify the results\:

 1. Set ORACLE_HOME and ORACLE_SID in the terminal to the targets.
 2. Log in to Data Guard\: dgmgrl sys/password
 3. Run this command\: show configuration



 Additional Documentation

Additional information about HP Database and Middleware Automation is available on HP Live Network\:

"http\://hpln.hp.com/group/database-and-middleware-automation"\:http\://hpln.hp.com/group/database-and-middleware-automation

To access the documentation, click the RESOURCES link and enter your HP Passport credentials.
65c5a793-a94e-4d0b-a284-3b808a5d4722.ecb26ef7-c649-44c5-a38b-31db8e336b81.description=6c25e88f-f192-4780-b9e7-99f3c2079ea1.94e5ed95-033c-46b0-b534-45c11a67dc34.description 65c5a793-a94e-4d0b-a284-3b808a5d4722.fdc28693-b22d-4486-a629-19a87b5c0caf.description=Description\: This step performs a Data Guard switchover operation in an existing Data Guard Broker configuration. Dependencies\: A valid Broker configuration must exist, and the primary DB must be running on the specified target server. In addition\: - The primary database must be assigned the PRIMARY role. - TRANSPORT-ON must be specified for the primary database. - The Switchover DB Unique Name parameter must specify a valid database unique name for one of the standby databases in the configuration. - The standby database for the switchover must be assigned the PHYSICAL STANDBY role. - APPLY-ON must be specified for this standby database. Return Code\: 0 \= Step ran successfully 1 \= Step failed Inputs\: command - executes PerformDataGuardSwitchoverv2.py Call Wrapper - Required\: Command that will execute the step. Oracle Home - Oracle Home of the target database Oracle SID - Oracle SID of target machine Oracle sys password - Required\: SYS Password for the primary and secondary databases. Primary DB Unique Name - No description Switchover DB Unique Name - Required\: Unique name of the standby database that will become the primary database in a switchover or failover operation. This parameter is required if the Switchover or Failover task is specified. host - Target to run this command against password - Login information for host username - Login information for host protocol - ssh/wmi timeout - Time (ms) before auto-exit\: use ${ExtendedTimeout} to lengthen. Results\: Exit Code - Exit code of the step needed for branching.
flow.name: Oracle - Data Guard Broker Switchover

staticBinding.value: ${openArgs}Call Wrapper=${instanceWrapper};;Oracle Home=${oracleHome_2};;Oracle SID=${oracleSID_2};;Oracle sys password=${oracleSysPassword_2};;Primary DB Unique Name=${primaryDBUniqueName};;Switchover DB Unique Name=${switchoverDBUniqueName_2};;Debug Level=${debugLevel};;Server Target=${serverTarget};;Instance Target=${instanceTarget};;Database Target=${databaseTarget}${closeArgs}

step.name: Gather Parameters for Data Guard Broker Switchover
step.resultContextKey: Gather Parameters for Data Guard Broker Switchover

staticBinding.value: ${openArgs}Oracle Account=${oracleAccount};;Oracle sys password=${oracleSysPassword};;Primary Node Hostnames=${primaryNodeHostnames};;Standby Node Hostnames=${standbyNodeHostnames};;Switchover DB Unique Name=${switchoverDBUniqueName};;Instance.Name=${instanceTarget};;Server.Become Routine=${server.BecomeRoutine};;Debug Level=${debugLevel};;Server Target=${serverTarget};;Instance Target=${instanceTarget};;Database Target=${databaseTarget}${closeArgs}

${openArgs}Call Wrapper=${serverWrapper};;Oracle Home=${oracleHome};;Oracle SID=${oracleSID};;Oracle sys password=${oracleSysPassword};;Oracle user name=${oracleAccount};;Primary Node Hostnames=${primaryNodeHostnames};;Standby Node Hostnames=${standbyNodeHostnames};;Switchover DB Unique Name=${switchoverDBUniqueName};;Debug Level=${debugLevel};;Server Target=${serverTarget};;Instance Target=${instanceTarget};;Database Target=${databaseTarget}${closeArgs}
